mainPackage

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • mainPackage.Component
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Component
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A component object is basically a molecule. It is made of a formula describing a chemical composition, a name and a density. If a component is created by the TopLevelInterface, then the component is read-only.
    Author:
    Alan Guitard
    See Also:
    PeriodicTable, Material, Serializable, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Component

        public Component(boolean b)
        Constructor. Create a new empty component with the name UnknownX, where X is a positive integer.
        Parameters:
        b - if true, the component is read-only.

      • Component

        public Component(java.lang.String name,
         boolean b)
        Constructor. Create a new empty component with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - the specified name.
        b - if true, the component is read-only.

      • Component

        public Component(java.lang.String name,
         float dens,
         boolean b)
        Constructor. Create a new empty component with the specified name and the specified density.
        Parameters:
        name - the specified name.
        dens - the specified density.
        b - if true, the component is read-only.
